comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The photo above was taken from Hen & Chicken Bay, off the Parramatta River, looking north-west. The Australian Gas Light Company holder No 3 at Mortlake, constructed 1917, was the largest built in the Southern Hemisphere, and one of the largest in the World. Also, the smaller No 2 gasholder can be seen peeping through the trees to its right. Correys Wharf at right, was an embarkation point for the Cabarita picnic grounds (here c1920, from Canada Bay Connections): [ www.flickr.com/photos/canadabayconnections/8484938270/in/...] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/canadabayconnections/8484938270/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Thanks Andy :) We were wondering what that structure was, it is so distinct. Your information has now been added to our records.
